newsitem.title: GERMANY: Frankfurt to host German car shows in 1999, 2001.
newsitem.headline: Frankfurt to host German car shows in 1999, 2001.

text.p: The VDA German Automobile Association said on Tuesday that the IAA international car shows in 1999 and 2001 will be held in Frankfurt.
The German car shows, the biggest in Europe, are held every two years. The last exposition in 1995 was held in Frankfurt as will the next show in 1997.
The VDA also said that the a exposition dedicated to trucks will next take place in Hanover in 1998, but that the site will move to Frankfurt in 2000.
Frankfurt to host German car shows in 1999, 2001
Frankfurt, Germany's financial capital, beat bids from Berlin and Munich for the show. The VDA said it could not award the show to either city because they were not able to offer suitable dates.
The 1997 car show will take place in Frankfurt between September 11 and 21, 1997 while the next truck show in Hannover is scheduled for September 5 to 13, 1998.
The IAA car show is one of the world's oldest, dating back to 1897 when it was held in Berlin. Frankfurt has hosted the show regularly since 1951.
